airbnb.Description: Spacious and bright 2-floor apartment with big third floor deck looking to the CN Tower. Amazing neighbourhood with markets, cafes, parks and pool, close to U of T and five minutes to the subway. This is a spacious and clean two-story apartment in a house with character and modern renovations. Perfect for a couple or a family. The apartment is on the 2nd and 3rd floors. On the second floor you have a living room, study, kitchen, sunroom, the bathroom and a washer/dryer. The kitchen is well stocked with spices and tools. There is Apple TV and Netflix of course. On the third floor are two large bedrooms. The adult bedroom has a queen-sized bed with latex mattress. The child's bedroom has games, books and drawing supplies. Both have storage. From the master bedroom, there is a walk out to your furnished private deck with sightlines to downtown Toronto and the CN Tower.  A public pool with three areas - children, diving and swimming lanes - is five minutes to the east walking. Tennis court

airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: We think this is the best neighbourhood in Toronto. It has a mix of families, students, couples and long-time residents and a diversity of shops and activities that cater to everyone. And because it's right on the Bloor subway you can explore the whole city without a car.  Our local park, Christie Pits, is 5 minutes away. It has an outdoor pool - with slide - and summer festivals almost every weekend.  The Dufferin Grove farmers' market on Thursday and the Wychwood Barns Saturday market are also nearby. Bloor Street, 5 minutes south, has multiple coffee bars, restaurants, pubs, a bookshoop, record stores and more. Dovercourt Village is two blocks away  and has a new gourmet pizzeria, a great local coffee and brunch restaurant, flowers and now, a hairdresser. If you are taking a summer course at U of T, you can easily bike there along dedicated bike paths the whole way.

airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: Our neighbourhood can be best described as 'changing' with mixed incomes.  There are million dollar condos near by inexpensive student digs supporting both Ryerson and George Brown College.  As the area is developing, more and more condos are being built, pushing some of the local street life out. With such a short walk to all the city has to offer, it's no surprise that this area is rapidly changing and the population is growing. It's a fantastic place to be!  As with any large city, you will encounter homeless people in the downtown core. Generally they are harmless, but be aware. If you are not comfortable with this, you might want to consider a location further from downtown.

airbnb.Description: Welcome to your home away from home! This private 1 bedroom apartment includes plenty of living space, a queen sized bed, kitchen, and HD TV with Netflix. You'll be minutes away Yorkdale Shopping Centre, grocery stores, and quaint restaurants and bars. Toronto's downtown core is a quick subway ride away and the Toronto Pearson Airport is a 15 minute drive. Enjoy Toronto by living like a local! From the moment you walk in, you'll feel right at home. This spacious 1 bedroom apartment offers you all the amenities you'll need to make your trip a great one. Upstairs, you'll find the master bedroom with Queen-sized organic mattress, the second bedroom with a comfy double bed, and the toddler's room with bed, as well as the bathroom. airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: The Junction Triangle is developing a reputation as one of the coolest parts of Toronto, and with good reason: it's the place to be if you're looking for the awesome and the unexpected. Our street, for instance, is a charming, quiet semi-residential spot, but don't let that fool you: there's an axe-throwing league across the street, a brewery just down the street, coffee shop up the street, Drake recorded his first mixtape here, and artists and Crossfit enthusiasts roam the streets on weekend mornings. The whole neighbourhood's like that: full of unexpected and inspiring surprises. And best of all, our place is close to pretty much everywhere you want to be.  It's a 15-minute walk to High Park (just in time for the cherry blossom festival), 15 minutes to Roncesvalles, a 10-minute walk to Dundas and College Streets, two minutes from Bloor Street, and we're also located right on the West Toronto Railpath, the perfect destination for runners, bikers and walkers alike.

airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: --The "Lakeshore Village" shopping district, located along Lakeshore Boulevard West, is a busy retail corridor that features fast food and family-style restaurants, and a wide mix of stores including food markets, bakeries, delis, coffee shops, bargain stores, drug stores, and convenience stores. ------------------------------------------------------------------------ --New Toronto is a neighbourhood in transition as the industrial corridor located at the north end of the neighbourhood has recently been converted to residential zoning. airbnb.Description: This condo in an old-school low-rise building is on a quiet street in the heart of Toronto. A perfect locale for business travellers, with both subway lines a block away, Rosedale, Yorkville and the Gay Village are also at your doorstep. In the 1950s, this was a hotel, and in the 1990s it  was restored and renovated. The character and charm of this building resembles the style of the New York apartment life. The one-bedroom condo, 745 sq ft, is a corner unit, so there's lots of light throughout the day.  The living/dining area is divided into three separate areas Ñ lounge area, dining and work space. The galley kitchen, in a separate room, has lots of room for prep and includes a dishwasher and a Tassimo, with a well-stocked cupboard of pods for you to indulge in. Laundry facilities are beside the kitchen, and include a washer/dryer for your use. The bedroom, with a queen bed, is big and serene, and comes with a (seriously) spacious en-suite bathroom. airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: This is an eclectic neighbourhood Ñ by day it's bustling because it's very close to several major office towers and shopping districts. In the evening, Yorkville's restaurant/bar scene picks up and the gay village comes alive. You have your choice of grocery stores within blocks (including a Whole Foods), as well as cinemas, parks, libraries and cafes. The Royal Ontario Museum, Gardiner Museum and Royal Conservatory of Music are within walking distance; the Art Gallery of Ontario, Air Canada Centre, Rogers Centre and CN Tower are a quick subway ride away. It's hard to find a more central location with which to experience Toronto.

airbnb.Description: Shared fully-detached house in the Annex with four housemates, big shared common spaces, a large yard, plenty of car and bike parking.  The Spadina subway station is literally a 20 second walk away, and Bloor street is around the corner, where you can find plenty of restaurants, shops, and within a single block there are two 24 hour grocery stores and a Shoppers Drug Mart. We welcome people of all ages and backgrounds! We occasional community events like live music, storytelling, movie nights, shared meals, etc., which you'd be welcome to join as desired. You can use anything in the house, including a well stocked kitchen, laundry, internet, projector/screen/sound system (great for movies!), tools, a bike, work space, etc.. At least one of us will be around/you'll have our contact info if you have any questions about anything in the house or the city! We're RIGHT next to a TTC subway hub, so it doesn't really get much better than this, transit-wise.

airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: Riverdale is a thriving residential neighborhood in Toronto, located just east of the downtown core. Since its amendment to the City of Toronto in 1884, it has developed a stature as a neighborhood of independent arts, with several independent galleries located along Queen Street East. The residential landscape within Riverdale is made up primarily of Victorian and Edwardian style homes, constructed in the 1800s as boarding rooms for the working-class. Many of the residences have since been redeveloped into homes for young families with homes redesigned to fit the tree-lined streetscape. In recent times, local housing values have increased significantly. With this a new generation of young professionals and their families have moved into the area, furthering already widespread gentrification. Riverdale's character is composed primarily from its multiculturalism; with several cultural neighborhood along its major paths. Danforth Avenue (commonly referred to as "The Danforth" in Greek To

airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: We are located right on the dividing line of Old Town and Church-Yonge Corridor and enjoy the best of both worlds.  Old Town is a mishmash of restored historic attractions and trendy new developments. Farther east, the historic Distillery District is one of Toronto's hottest entertainment destinations. It's filled with restored Victorian-era factories that house contemporary galleries, bustling pubs, and chic restaurants. - quoted from fodor's travel Church-Yonge Corridor is famous for its unique diversity. It is home to Toronto's most vibrant LGBT community, hosting parade during the summertime. You can experience the concerts, parades, discussion panels, exhibits, and more during this week-long celebration.

airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: This is a walking neighbourhood.  Adults walk to the subway, some on their way to work, some on their way to school.  Lots of people pass by while walking their dogs, others walking to nearby religious services on Saturdays, and still others just walking for pleasure.  Children walk by our house everyday on their way to the school behind us, so I've strategically set up ornamental animals in my front garden for them to spot and smile at...there is a turtle, an elephant, a bunny, a cat and a squirrel.  In the winter they peek through the snow, and spring and fall they are much easier to spot.

Pretty safe, nothing fancy, divided between apartments and houses.  It is suburbia but there are plenty of lovely restaurants around. I recommend East Side Marios at Dufferin and Steeles, Mr. Greek at Dufferin and Finch, and several places on Yonge Street, the main drag, especially between Finch and Sheppard. If you don't mind walking, Mel Lastman Square is about 5_ km away and often features musical acts and other live entertainment and street festivals. In the square and around is a subway station and one of the city's biggest libraries.

airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: Little Italy is a very trendy and lively neighbourhood that is in high demand for its great location and atmosphere.  Plenty of cool restaurants, bars, cafes, and shops on the strip, so there's lots to check out and enjoy.  There's even a cool local cinema, The Royal, just across the street from us.  Two of Toronto's biggest, coolest parks are nearby: Trinity Bellwoods (our favourite) to the South, and Christie Pits to the North, both of which are a 5-10 minute walk.  College Street is a main artery of the city and it supports 24h Streetcar Service.  There's also Christie Subway station just 10 minutes walking distance away, so the rest of the city is highly accessible from this location.

airbnb.Description: A twin bed in a private room (9 ft x 10 ft) next to a fully renovated bathroom. Clean towels, sheets & 2 pillows. Chest of drawers.  A window to the backyard. Use of fully renovated kitchen. You will share the renovated bathroom with me. Our cozy bungalow is in a very safe and quiet neighbourhood near a grocery store, pharmacy, family restaurants and a large park/ravine. The bus stop is just 1 min away and  serves 2 bus routes. There is an open air park and concert venue nearby (Woodbine Park) which has an event every weekend, it seems. Woofstock, Craft shows, Ribfests, concerts, to name a few. Mid July (July 21- 23rd) the main street of the Beaches is shut down for the annual Beaches Jazz festival.

airbnb.Description: If you like buildings with a story, this is it. This is a great place to stay when you need an escape to a "cabin" in the middle of a bustling downtown city.  This space used to be a mattress factory back in the day, but has now evolved to become a work/live space. I run a small fitness studio out of my home a couple of hours a week, and have minimal furniture, but a whole lot of space. Perfect for dancers, artists and lovers of rustic factory buildings, this is a trip back to a time when things were made of metal, glass and wood.  This building still holds its original wood floors and wood ceilings. It is quite rare to find a space which remains more raw, and we love it that way. The new upgrades exist where they count most: new windows for heat, and wireless internet for the pace of modern living. Your sleeping quarters are up in my custom built loft. Lots of great restaurants, art galleries, vintage clothes shops, basically the new, hot, up and coming neighborhood in the city. Annette St. is the closest main street just steps from the apartment, and the first shop you'll come to is Creme Fraiche, which will make you a great Americano to start your day. airbnb.Description: My place is cozy with lots of space to unwind. It's in a well located, vibrant, but quiet neighbourhood. It's close to downtown and parks and in a very transit-friendly area. My house has a covered front patio and luscious back garden. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, families (with kids) and big groups. I'm an architect, so my house has a particular sensibility that highlights the house's original character, and builds on it with modern interventions. Your space would be private, no interaction with myself or tenants. My house is divided into two units. The tenants upstairs do not have access to your unit. The space is perfect for a couple as it only has one queen mattress. Additional guests could sleep on couches or on the blow up mattress. The unit consists of a main floor with living room, dining room and a large kitchen. In the bright basement you'll find the bed, washroom and tv den. airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: At the top of the street: Dundas West and Little Portugal are a mix of Portuguese Canadian culture and new cafes, bars and great cuisine. You are a short stroll from one of the city's most popular parks, Trinity Bellwoods. Catch the farmer's market there on Tuesday afternoons.  At the bottom of the street: Queen Street West is one of the coolest streets in the city and according to Vogue magazine, the 2nd coolest street in the world. Here you'll find Parkdale to the West. A grittier neighbourhood with vintage shopping, boutiques and a large Tibetian community.  Go East and you'll find the Gladstone Hotel and the Drake Hotel to have breakfast, brunch, lunch or dinner or drinks and live entertainment. Lots of cafes restaurants and shopping. This is the more gentrified section of Queen Street. Keep walking and you'll find all kinds of independent retail boutiques mixed with chain stores.

airbnb.Description: Quiet  one bedroom w/very comfortable double bed overlooking beautiful backyard.  Down pillows/duvet.  Full bathroom.  WiFi.   Continental breakfast included. Seven minute walk to Coxwell subway station.  Parking available at an extra charge. (Cats on premises.) A cozy non-smoking house on a quiet street.   Access to main floor and yard. I enjoy sharing conversation with my guests but always respect their privacy. Close to Toronto's Greektown,  Little India and The Beaches with their many shops, restaurant/cafes and clubs.  Thirty minutes by subway to Toronto City Hall, fifteen minutes by car. Coxwell subway station is a five minute walk away..  Street parking is available at an extra charge. Taxis are nearby. TV in shared living/dining room.  Complimentary Wifi. Choice of either feather/down or synthetic pillows and duvet.

airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: Located in the heart of Toronto's Downtown Core between the financial and entertainment districts. Great location on a quiet street. Walking distance to all downtown Toronto attractions. Access to Queen Street West and King Street West are both just down the street. Minutes away from the Four Seasons Centre for Performing Arts, Roy Thompson Concert Hall, the Toronto International Film Festival and many theatres. Enjoy the best restaurants, bars, bakeries, and bistros in town all within walking distance. If you are looking for shopping, the Eaton Centre is located 3 blocks away and Queen Street boutiques are two blocks away. If you like sports, the Air Canada Centre and Rogers Centre are within walking distance, as is the Metro Toronto Convention Centre, the CN Tower, and the AGO.  There is a Tim Hortons and convenience store located on the ground floor of the building. A small 24 hour grocery store and 24 hour drug store are nearby.

airbnb.Description: This bright 2-bed apartment with south-facing deck is located on a quiet street close to where it's all going on. Walk to the bars, restaurants and galleries of Dundas West and Parkdale in 5 to 15 mins. Enjoy the space as your home away from home.       This 2-bedroom apartment has high ceilings, large windows, and lots of natural light. Spread over the top two floors of a 100+ year-old house, it has two double bedrooms and a south-facing deck on the 3rd floor, and a living-room, bathroom, and open-plan kitchen/dining-room on the main floor. It has original hardwood floors throughout and a recently updated kitchen and bathroom.  You will have full use of the apartment for the duration of your stay, including the deck on the 3rd floor. You are also welcome to use the front porch of the house - a nice spot to sit and watch the world go by. There is a second apartment, spread over the main and basement levels of the house. I'll leave you to your own devices if that's what you prefer,

airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: The apartment is located on a quiet residential street in Little Portugal, with its mix of hip new bars, restaurants and clothing stores, and beloved old Portuguese bakeries and cafes. Parkdale and Queen West are a 10 minute walk away. It's also a short walk to Roncesvalles (Little Poland) to the west or to Bloor and Lansdowne to the north, all of which have their own distinct feel and are worth exploring! The Dundas streetcar takes you directly to Kensington Market, the Art Gallery of Ontario and Yonge-Dundas Square. If you stay on it long enough it'll take you through Toronto's second Chinatown in the east end and up to Greektown on the Danforth.   If staying close to home is more your thing, there's a fantastic bakery, cafe, Vietnamese restaurant, pub, indoor ice rink and a park all within a couple of blocks. The supermarket is a 5-minute walk.  If you're bringing your bike, you can be riding the trail next to Lake Ontario 10 minutes after leaving the house.   If you're bringing you

airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: We love the new restaurants, art galleries and cafes that have exploded on our strip of Bloor Street in the last 10 years.  The Emerson Restaurant serves great food in a chic and cozy atmosphere.  Karelia Kitchen serves amazing Scandanavian Cuisine.  Three Speed, Stella and Bar Neon are great bars and Burdock is a great brew pub and live music venue right at the bottom of the street.  Cheap food abounds with Duffy's, Jerk King (Jamaican) and Masala Dosa (Vegetarian / Indian).  The Whiporwill has good breakfasts.  All are located on the strip of Bloor that runs between Dufferin and Landsdowne.

airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: A regal respite: This neighbourhood is called Regal Heights and is bounded by Davenport, Dufferin, St. Clair and Winona. It is an area full of royalty (Mount Royal, Regal RoadÉ), so consider yourself king or queen, prince or princess during your time here.  A watery wonder: Enjoy your beachside stay: the Davenport escarpment is the shoreline of prehistoric Lake Iroquois. And youÕre actually in an ancient riverbed right now. Garrison Creek, which was so polluted at the turn of the last century that it was put in underground piping, is running just about right under you.  An ancient throughway: Davenport Road is one of the oldest streets in Toronto. First Nations used a path along the base of Davenport hill to connect the Humber and Don rivers. This area has been inhabited by the Hurons and then the Iroquois in the 17th century, and the Ojibway (a group later called the Mississaugas) from the early 18th to mid-19th centuries. Fave Cafs    Alcoa Portuguese Bakery and Caf: S side of Dave

airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: Humber Summit is a quiet, clean, safe, serene, & fairly affluent area, and homes here are very well maintained. Pride of ownership is evident throughout. There is a large park (with river) & public library within a short walk away; a pizzeria, a Caribbean restaurant, and a corner store are all within a 3-4 minute walk. Just 2 km walk or 2 minutes by car is Little India which features quite a few Indian restaurants and a Chinese restaurant. Four minutes away by car is Albion Mall where you'll find a large food court, a movie theater, a Sushi restaurant, and a large supermarket.

airbnb.Description: A stunning new space in the heart of King Street West. A bright and inviting unit with 9 foot ceilings, and hardwood floors throughout. This suite includes everything for a great stay: an ultra modern kitchen, comfortable living area, sleek dining table and chairs, luxurious bedroom with queen sized bed, clean bathroom with shower, plus washer/dryer. It doesn't get better than this! A prime A+ location, close to all sights and attractions in Toronto. A perfect space for a couple that wants to be in the middle of the hottest neighbourhood in Toronto. Enjoy hanging out on the over-sized couch while you watch TV, or browse the high speed wireless Internet.  The stunning, modern kitchen is ready for anything you want to create. It's perfect for enjoying cocktails around or make a quick meal while you're on-the-go.  The queen sized bed is very comfortable and has fresh linens each time you stay.  The bathroom is clean and bright. The Spa shower has great water pressure and seamless glass.

airbnb.Description: The only apartment (covering the second floor) in a building from the 1920s, this charming 1-bedroom is the perfect base to explore the city from. Walk out the front door onto Queen West, voted second-hippest neighbourhood in the world by Vogue. As the only apartment in the building, you'll have your own hallway and door to the street. Up the stairs in the hallway, you'll find a massive chalkboard wall that we'd love you to leave a drawing or note on! It is an older building with lots of character. Also, please keep in mind that my girlfriend Jorja and I actually live in this apartment. It's not an empty sterile rental, and we hope you appreciate it for what it is :) The kitchen has everything you'd need to cook, a little herb garden to add some fresh flavour to your meals, and space for up to 8 people to dine together. airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: My Top 3 Lists: Coffee: 1 - Early Bird, 613 Queen St W. Best pour-overs in the city in a beautiful caf perfect for working or meeting someone. Also has a great tea list. 2 - Offsite, 867 Dundas St W. Part coffee shop, part concept store, this place is an airy and gorgeous place to get some work done during the day. 3 - White Squirrel, 907 Queen St W. Named after the infamous white squirrel of Trinity Bellwoods Park, this cute coffee shop is right across the street from the park and serves gelato in the summer! Restaurants: 1 - Nana, 785 Queen St W. Inspired by the Bangkok neighbourhood with the same name, Nana is fun, delicious, casual, and exploratory. Try the boat noodle soup or the chicken laab. 2 - Terroni, 720 Queen St W. Traditional Italian food done right. Great environment for a group dinner. 3 - Lamesa, 669 Queen St W. airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: Rosedale is one of the best things our diverse and progressive city has to offer. When Toronto was the smallish city of York of the 19th century, Rosedale was one farm, named for the wild and domesticated roses that grew so well on the hills. Now it is where Canada's top entertainers, business leaders, and most established families live. But unlike many other 'old' neighbourhoods - it is a diverse place where people of different cultures, sexual orientations and other things that in the past have divided us have vanished.

airbnb.Description: This 2 bed/2bath home is located in the more northern part of the downtown core called West Annex/Seaton Village and is on a cul de sac w/parking.  Steps from TTC, Yorkville,art galleries, restos & more. The small urban-chic, clean and bright home boasts two balconies off either bed & rustic front/ backyard off kitchen. The house is small semi-detached, and is newly renovated and updated and  sleeps 6 people.  The owners work in fashion and music, so it has a very cool vibe and is in a prime location on a charming cul-de-sac. The house is comfy, clean, and has an amazing kitchen that walks out to the rustic backyard.  Both bedrooms have their own balconies, and the house is equipped with everything you need. Lock-box to grab keys, and everything you need is in the house! Please let us know if you're bringing a car, as our neighbours use the spot sometimes.  Guests will have access to free WiFi, TV, and parking.   All linens & towels are included in your stay.  Private backyard, and two

airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: Our home is located in Seaton Village/West Annex, and we love our neighbours!  It's the more northern part of the downtown core in a family oriented neighbourhood.  It is super close to Caseloma, Yorkville, Bloor St., Art Galleries, Museums, tons of restaurants, yoga and Pilates studios and more.  Remarkably, this neighbourhood has managed to maintain the feel of a small town village, even though it is situated in bustling downtown Toronto.  There is a train close by, so please advise if you are super sensitive to sounds.

airbnb.Description: Two bedroom apartment on second and third floor of a spacious Victorian in Parkdale. On a tree lined streets between Queen st. W and Dundas st. W. Great bars, restaurants and parks all a short walk away.  Laundry and wifi in the house. It's a three bedroom apartment with lots of common area. Kitchen, Laundry and the Living Room, as well as a spacious backyard I run my own renovations company.  I work fairly long hours but am often around in the evenings.   I live in the same space and I am around most evenings. The tree lined streets are great.  It's within walking distance of two great parks (Trinity Belwoods and High Park).   The Queen street car is just down the street. Alternatively, it's a 5 minute bus ride to the subway.  I have two cats.  They are very friendly.

FREE: 1 parking space, Wi-fi, Bell Fibe TV, Netflix, Kodi & Keurig coffee. Perfect for couples, small families or professionals! airbnb.Neighborhood Overview: The neighbourhood is Little Portugal/Bloor West/Bloordale.. we're in a cusp of neighbourhoods which means more fun to explore! We are within walking distance (2-3K) of little italy, parkdale and the junction. I have a ton of information printed in a binder on neighbourhoods, restaurants, coffee spots (trust me), bars and adventure spots to check out while you're here. The neighbourhood is a beautiful mix of hustle and hushed. Once you step off Bloor and onto our side street, everything turns into a quiet and safe family neighbourhood.. but not far from the front door is a plethora of bars and restaurants that are a must try!
